# Introduction {.unnumbered}

This online supplement provides code and reproducible examples for the article titled *'A scalable toolbox for exposing indirect discrimination in insurance rates.'*

:::{.callout-important}

## Paper on TBD

The paper is available on TBD:
 
[Pre-print submitted to the CAS reasearch paper series on race and insurance pricing](https://www.casact.org/publications-research/research/research-paper-series-race-and-insurance-pricing)

:::

:::{.callout-note}
All the codes are written in R.
:::

## Outline

This ebook contains three chapters:

1. [Chapter -@sec-simul-dataset]: Presentation of the three scenarios for the simulated example.
2. [Chapter -@sec-training]: Estimating the spectrum from simulations.
3. [Chapter -@sec-dim]: Illustration of the dimensions of fairness.
4. [Chapter -@sec-local]: Local metrics of fairness
5. [Chapter -@sec-partition]: Presentation of the three scenarios for the simulated example.
6. [Chapter -@sec-integrated]: Estimating the spectrum from simulations.
